bestBHT.bht: When we fail to extend hospitality to strangers, neglect to provide clothing for the naked, and do not visit the sick and imprisoned, our actions reveal a reflection of our character. These words caution us against the consequences of disregarding the basic principles of compassion and empathy. We are reminded that the righteous path entails embodying kindness and demonstrating care for our fellow human beings.

John Gill: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in...
...naked, and ye clothed me not: sick and in prison, and ye visited me not...
Their conduct, behaviour, and character, are just the reverse of the righteous...

bhtAttempts.bht: When we read Matthew 25:43, we are confronted with a solemn reminder of the importance of compassion and empathy. This verse highlights the consequences of failing to extend hospitality and care to those in need. The words I was a stranger, and ye took me not in...naked, and ye clothed me not: sick and in prison, and ye visited me not... convey the disappointment that comes from neglecting to show kindness to our fellow human beings. These actions, or rather, the lack thereof, demonstrate a deviation from the righteous path and a failure to uphold the values that we should hold dear.

When we fail to extend hospitality to strangers, neglect to provide clothing for the naked, and do not visit the sick and imprisoned, our actions reveal a reflection of our character. These words caution us against the consequences of disregarding the basic principles of compassion and empathy. We are reminded that the righteous path entails embodying kindness and demonstrating care for our fellow human beings.

When we choose not to welcome strangers, or clothe the naked, or visit the sick and imprisoned, we deviate from the conduct and character of the righteous. These actions, or rather, the lack thereof, expose our failure to extend compassion and care to those in need. Matthew 25:43 serves as a poignant reminder of the significance of showing hospitality and empathy towards others, underscoring the consequences of neglecting to do so.

When we turn away strangers in need, refuse to clothe the naked, and neglect to visit the sick and imprisoned, our behavior diverges completely from that of the righteous. These actions, or lack thereof, serve as a stark contrast to the compassion and care we ought to demonstrate. The verse underscores the significance of extending hospitality and empathy towards others, reminding us of the repercussions of failing to do so.

When we neglect to take in strangers, fail to clothe the naked, and overlook the sick and imprisoned, our conduct and character reflect the opposite of the righteous. These words highlight the repercussions of lacking compassion and empathy towards others. They serve as a reminder of the importance of extending hospitality and care to those in need. Our actions, or lack thereof, reveal our deviation from the values that should guide us in our interactions with our fellow human beings.
